intro: Isanthera crenata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Isanthera crenata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
